Description: Mudstone (greywacke) palette carved in the shape of a fish with a pointed nose, small mouth indicated by a small incision, drilled eye, short incised strokes along the top edge, and longer incisions detailing the tail, which is contiguous with the contour of the body and not separated. Single piercing at top.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 58. Like palette type 47 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921). The abbreviated form, with simplified body form is generally considered to be later in date.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
